skillTree.localised_description: A gift from Nagash to a loyal servant, the hungering blade will extend the unholy existence of its wielder should he ever be in danger.
The skeleton on this weapon is known to scream in agony. No sound is produced, yet all close to it feel its pain and witness its torment.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

skillTree.localised_description: The Hand of Nagash was known to terrorize the lands on his mighty chariot, filled with dark magic.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Skeleton Warriors

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord of Undeath projects an aura of dominion that can wilt the most iron-willed mortals.
A dark pact has been made with darker Gods to guarantee victory.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Where the Hand of Nagash goes, fear and despair follow.
The Hand of Nagash has always been infamous for their merciless use of chariots and riders.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 for Nehekhara Horsemen, Skeleton Horse Archers, Skeleton Chariot and Skeleton Archer Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +20% for Skeleton Chariots and Skeleton Archer Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +20% for Skeleton Archer Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No land is too remote, no place is truly ever out of reach.
Magic made the Hand what he is now, but in war he prefers cold steel over the might of magic.
Burn the cities of the living so they may join us in death.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +8% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Focussing the winds of death around him, the Hand of Nagash can unleash a devastating wave of destruction.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
"Look into mine eyes, mortal; what glories do you see?"
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
To be honest it is mostly executioner. Everyone who stands against Nagash is guilty by default.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "I am mighty, none dare challenge me!"

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

skillTree.localised_description: The many ranks of archers and artillery batteries will darken the sky and reap many souls.

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

Armour: +10 for Mummies, Cairn Wraiths, Skeleton Hoplites, Skeleton Pikemen, Royal Guards, Crypt Ghouls, Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: The power of death cannot be denied.

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
The sun is no ally of the dead - a sky scorched black, or darkest night, will invigorate the Unliving.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

Attrition: -10% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

Attrition: -15% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

skillTree.localised_description: Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

items.colour_text: A gift from Nagash himself. When its wielder fades, the blade awakens and feeds him with the life force of its victims so he may persist against all odds.

An enemy so hated by the Hand that he was strapped on a halberd and is used as a battlestandard even after death. Those who came close enough and survived swear that the skeleton still screams in agony. Without a sound, yet unbearably loud.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: In the name of Nagash, all kingdoms must fall. There is no rest, no peace and no mercy.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle
